value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is here!
value.excerpt: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is finally here! In this video, Patrick takes what Adam did with a custom date table and shows you how you can use Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop. This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick introduces the Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh. This is the MEQM! A report that can be useful to see SQL Server queries that Power BI issues during refresh.  MEQM Files - https://github.com/guyinacube/demo-files/tree/master/video%20demos/MEQM  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy

value.title: Measuring RLS Performance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you tried measuring performance of Row-Level Security (RLS) in Power BI? How much overhead does it have? That can be a challenge using the tools we talk about. Adam shows you how you can do it!  RLS Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv2BtOtLblH1dBK34FqClo2eXXQgWW1ui  RLS Course: https://guyinacu.be/rlscourse

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample

value.title: Modify the Power BI Concatenated list of values quick measure
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to use a Power BI quick measure and then easily modify it. In this example, he uses the concatenated list of values quick measure in Power BI Desktop.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/

value.title: Power BI dataflows: One thing you probably missed with your gateway
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can get your gateway working with Power BI dataflows, even if you aren't an admin of the gateway. There is one thing that most people overlook. We show you what it is!  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. Different options exist, such as Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services or models hosted in the Power BI service.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Publish to Web got some awesome new updates in Power BI!
value.excerpt: I know, I know! We talk a lot about using caution with Publish to Web in Power BI. But! Publish to Web got some new updates that are pretty nice! Adam walks you through them. value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release.
